info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 7:43AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...GUSTY SNOW SHOWERS MOVING INTO NORTHWEST INDIANA... At 740 AM EST/640 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a band of gusty snow showers along a line extending from near Three Oaks to near La Porte to near Trail Creek. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, brief drops in visibility, and patchy slick spots on bridges and overpasses. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. The combination of falling snow and strong winds may briefly reduce visibility, and lead to slick spots on bridges and overpasses including during the Monday morning commute. Locations impacted include... South Bend, Mishawaka, Michigan City, La Porte, Plymouth, Westville, Bremen, Buchanan, Knox, Trail Creek, Gulivoire Park, Bridgman, Walkerton, North Liberty, New Buffalo, New Carlisle, North Judson, Three Oaks, Kingsford Heights, and Culver. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 38 and 78. Interstate 94 in Indiana between mile markers 33 and 45. Interstate 94 in Michigan between mile markers 0 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Motorists should be alert to rapidly changing driving conditions.
